etymology.description: Semantic 冃(冃) (mào, "hat") + phonetic 免(免) (miǎn) = ceremonial crown worn by nobles -> crown
etymology.interpretation: The character 冕(miǎn, "crown") combines 冃(冃) (mào, "hat") as a semantic component to signify headwear, with 免(免) (miǎn) providing the phonetic sound, capturing the concept of an ornate crown used in formal ceremonies.

examples.chinese: 上朝时欣赏冕(上朝時欣賞冕)，庆典中彰显荣耀(慶典中彰顯榮耀)。
examples.pinyin: Shàngcháo shí xīnshǎng miǎn, qìngdiǎn zhōng zhāngxiǎn róngyào.
examples.english: During the morning court, the crown is admired, and in the celebration, it symbolizes glory.
